page.title: 06Witherley Primary School
page.content:
Witherley School was first established in 1876. It was then called Witherley National School. Today, in 1985, there are 3 teachers and 65 children. The children live either in Witherley itself or one of the neighbouring villages such as Ratcliffe Culey or Atterton.
Children begin attending the school just before their fifth birthday and they normally leave at the age of 11.
One of the traditions of the school is that every Ascension Day, after a service in church, the children receive the gift of a bun, originally paid for from a bequest of a certain Nicholas Bailey, but nowadays paid for from church funds.
